intro: Hibiscus cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Hibiscus cubensis thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found near coastal areas or in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom throughout the growing season, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
